metadata.title: CVE-2021-47588 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: sit: donot call ipip6_dev_free() from sit_init_net() ipip6_dev_free is sitdev->priv_destructor, already called by register_netdevice() if somethinggoes wrong. Alternative would be to make ipip6_dev_free() robust againstmultiple invocations, but other drivers do not implement this strategy.syzbot reported: dst_release underflow WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 5059 atnet/core/dst.c:173 dst_release+0xd8/0xe0 net/core/dst.c:173 Modules linkedin: CPU: 1 PID: 5059 Comm: syz-executor.4 Not tainted 5.16.0-rc5-syzkaller#0 Hardware name: Google Google Compute Engine/Google Compute Engine, BIOSGoogle 01/01/2011 RIP: 0010:dst_release+0xd8/0xe0 net/core/dst.c:173 Code:4c 89 f2 89 d9 31 c0 5b 41 5e 5d e9 da d5 44 f9 e8 1d 90 5f f9 c6 05 87 48c6 05 01 48 c7 c7 80 44 99 8b 31 c0 e8 e8 67 29 f9 <0f> 0b eb 85 0f 1f 4000 53 48 89 fb e8 f7 8f 5f f9 48 83 c3 a8 48 RSP: 0018:ffffc9000aa5faa0EFLAGS: 00010246 RAX: d6894a925dd15a00 RBX: 00000000ffffffff RCX:0000000000040000 RDX: ffffc90005e19000 RSI: 000000000003ffff RDI:0000000000040000 RBP: 0000000000000000 R08: ffffffff816a1f42 R09:ffffed1017344f2c R10: ffffed1017344f2c R11: 0000000000000000 R12:0000607f462b1358 R13: 1ffffffff1bfd305 R14: ffffe8ffffcb1358 R15:dffffc0000000000 FS: 00007f66c71a2700(0000) GS:ffff8880b9a00000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000 CS: 0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033CR2: 00007f88aaed5058 CR3: 0000000023e0f000 CR4: 00000000003506f0 DR0:0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000 DR3:0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400 Call Trace:<TASK> dst_cache_destroy+0x107/0x1e0 net/core/dst_cache.c:160ipip6_dev_free net/ipv6/sit.c:1414 [inline] sit_init_net+0x229/0x550net/ipv6/sit.c:1936 ops_init+0x313/0x430 net/core/net_namespace.c:140setup_net+0x35b/0x9d0 net/core/net_namespace.c:326 copy_net_ns+0x359/0x5c0net/core/net_namespace.c:470 create_new_namespaces+0x4ce/0xa00kernel/nsproxy.c:110 unshare_nsproxy_namespaces+0x11e/0x180kernel/nsproxy.c:226 ksys_unshare+0x57d/0xb50 kernel/fork.c:3075__do_sys_unshare kernel/fork.c:3146 [inline] __se_sys_unsharekernel/fork.c:3144 [inline] __x64_sys_unshare+0x34/0x40 kernel/fork.c:3144do_syscall_x64 arch/x86/entry/common.c:50 [inline] do_syscall_64+0x44/0xd0arch/x86/entry/common.c:80 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xae RIP:0033:0x7f66c882ce99 Code: ff ff c3 66 2e 0f 1f 84 00 00 00 00 00 0f 1f 4000 48 89 f8 48 89 f7 48 89 d6 48 89 ca 4d 89 c2 4d 89 c8 4c 8b 4c 24 08 0f05 <48> 3d 01 f0 ff ff 73 01 c3 48 c7 c1 bc ff ff ff f7 d8 64 89 01 48 RSP:002b:00007f66c71a2168 EFLAGS: 00000246 ORIG_RAX: 0000000000000110 RAX:ffffffffffffffda RBX: 00007f66c893ff60 RCX: 00007f66c882ce99 RDX:0000000000000000 RSI: 0000000000000000 RDI: 0000000048040200 RBP:00007f66c8886ff1 R08: 0000000000000000 R09: 0000000000000000 R10:0000000000000000 R11: 0000000000000246 R12: 0000000000000000 R13:00007fff6634832f R14: 00007f66c71a2300 R15: 0000000000022000 </TASK>

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-105-generic - 5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1107-kvm - 4.15.0-1107.109
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-169.177').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1107.109').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.129').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1069.73~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1073.76~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1078.87').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2061.63').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2043.47').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2026.28').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.3').
linux-gcp-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.130').
linux-gcp-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gcp-5.4').
linux-gcp-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1068.72~18.04.1').
linux-gke-4.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-gke-5.0').
linux-gke-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.20~18.04.1').
linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1087.95').
linux-oracle-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.3').
linux-oracle-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oracle-5.4').
linux-oracle-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1067.72~18.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1056.63~18.04.1').
